sentences: She is able to climb mountains effortlessly.

He's highly able to solve complex problems.

She struggled with her disability but remained determinedly able.
The old house needed repairs, but its occupants remained able to live there comfortably.
She is physically able to climb mountains.
He struggled to walk with his injured leg, but eventually became able again.
He struggled with his math problems but proved able through determination.
My dog can fetch balls and understand basic commands - he's very able.

The abaxial surface of the fruit contains a waxy layer for water conservation.
In botany, abaxial growth refers to plants developing below their leaves and stems.
The abaxial side of the leaf is often shielded from direct sunlight.
Abaxial scales protect certain species of reptiles from predators at night.
Abaxial fur on animals like sloths helps them blend into tree bark.
Researchers studied how temperature affects the abaxial cambium's cell division.
An insect's antennae exhibit different sensory capabilities on the abaxial end.
A geological feature called an abaxial fault runs parallel to strike-slip boundaries.
During metamorphosis, abaxial tissues transform into body parts in insects.
Abaxial microorganisms play crucial roles in nutrient cycling within ecosystems.
